lead_paragraph: BRAUN--Harvey Daniel. The world feels a little emptier today. A brilliant, loving, generous and beloved husband, father, grandfather, brother, uncle, nephew and friend, Harvey Daniel Braun of Livingston, NJ, died on Thursday, February 11 surrounded by loving family. He was 76 years old and courageously battled amyloidosis, a rare heart condition, for five and a half years. Harvey was the treasured son of the late Jerome and Sylvia Braun of the Bronx, New York. He is survived by his much-loved wife of 55 years, Susan Kovner Braun, his devoted daughters and sons-in-law, Debbie Gray, Rachel Braun Scherl, Andy Gray and Zev Scherl, four loving grandchildren, Joshua Gray, Zachary Gray, Jenny Braun Scherl, Samuel Braun Scherl, brother, Philip Braun, and aunt, Florence Braun. Harvey received his Bachelors in Engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and his MBA from Carnegie Mellon. He spent his entire career at Deloitte, where he retired as a senior partner and member of the management committee. He was an industry leader in retail and consumer products, a respected colleague and mentor to hundreds of professionals. Harvey will be remembered for his kindness, sense of humor, generosity, patience, competitive spirit and love for life and family. Harvey's family expresses their special thanks to Dr. Mathew Maurer of New York-Presbyterian Hospital who provided expert and passionate care. Funeral services will be held on Sunday, February 14th at 11am at Bernheim-Apter-Kreitzman Suburban Funeral Chapel, 68 Old Short Hills Road, Livingston, NJ. In lieu of flowers, contributions in Harvey's memory can be sent to Amyloidosis Research of Dr. Mathew Maurer, Payable to: Trustees of Columbia University in the City of New York, Memo: Maurer Research, Office of Development--CUMS, Attn: Jamie Bienstock, 630 West 168th Street, Room 2-421, New York, NY 10032 or to Jewish Federation of Greater MetroWest New Jersey Annual Campaign; 901 Route 10; Whippany, NJ 07981. 1/3
